snippet: An effort to coordinate traditional schools and charters is a test for a superintendent and potentially a signal moment in American education.
abstract: Teachers and parents in Oakland, Calif, are fighting superintendent Antwan Wilson's plan to combine charter schools and public schools in one enrollment system; Wilson, who has drawn fire over his training at Eli and Edythe Broad Foundation, says single application form will reduce ability of well-connected parents to place their children in most desirable schools and force charters to be more open about how they admit students.

byline.contributor: Sarah Cohen contributed reporting from New York. Kitty Bennett contributed research.

lead_paragraph: An effort to coordinate traditional schools and charters is a test for a superintendent and potentially a signal moment in American education.

headline.main: Oakland District at Heart of Drive to Transform Urban Schools
headline.print_headline: Oakland Is Flash Point in Billionaire’s Push for Charter Schools
